intro: Diasperus pseudoniruri, commonly known as the false wire vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with slender stems and small, often hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Diasperus pseudoniruri is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
